description:
Audiophile is a music player built off of FFmpeg that plays many file formats that are not supported by the native music player including FLAC, wma, and others.  It also provides variable bass and treble control, along with the ability to fine tune volume level beyond the normal slider.  The program has its own indexer that will detect most of the music files on your usb card.  It also allows you to speed up or slow down the song, and to cross-fade songs on transition.  It downloads album art from Last.fm, supports Bluetooth controls, and allows you to set your current wallpaper as a background.

Note that the program works best with well specified music files, and may have trouble with certain older mp3 files or files that do not have properly formatted metadata.
versionNote: Bug fixes, pause on headphone removal added (with the option to turn it off), continue on headphone insertion option added, added theme to use your current wallpaper as background, Bluetooth control added, album art added, other graphical fixes.
